paragraph:
The brief for this project is to create a web app that lets people collect quick, objective and anonymous feedback.
        The app allows you to easily & intuitively create polls and share them select friends to aid decision making.
title: Types of Polls
note2: No text based responses since this is a polling app not a survey app. Text based responses can be introduced at a later stage.

paragraph2.image2: To use Tufte CSS, copy block:

paragraph3:
Now you just have to use the provided CSS rules, and the Tufte CSS conventions described in this document. For best
        results, View Source and Inspect Element frequently.
paragraph4:
No text based responses because that would change teh natire of teh application from a poll to a survey. Text based
        responses can be added in the future if we change teh way responses are collected and displayed.

As a bonus, this excerpt regarding the use of headings provides an example of block quotes. In Tufte CSS they are just
        lightly styled, semantically correct HTML using for an example in print.
paragraph5:
Collecting responses is as simple as clicking on a poll in your dashboard. You get a clear % breakdown of how many
        people clicked on what response. You can also see who you sent teh poll to and when teh poll ended, or will end if
        ongoing.
64bab3d5-9c74-43e3-a232-ba00b5598f7c:
When you get sent a poll are either given a url to follow, you get an email invite or a personall message in facebook.
        If you are new to the platform the link will take you to a sign up page.
4c06f167-8822-4e80-958f-7d374b82f141: If you already have an account the platform will log you in automatically and redirect you to teh poll page
3b655cfd-5ab8-4537-8c39-2e32ad0c568a:
Completing the polling app will take you to a success page taht lets you know you have successfully completed the poll.
        This page gives you the option to request the results of teh poll when it is complete. It also encourages you to
        create a poll f your own.
ca4486a9-5241-4507-9365-35120bb9392d:
If someone who was not invited to complete a poll gets a hold of teh poll link then trying to complete the poll will
        redierect them to an error page taht encourages then to sign up and send out tehir own private polls.
eb8c2eba-2e8f-4a34-851d-83f318001f67:
Collecting responses is as simple as clicking on a poll in your dashboard. You get a clear % breakdown of how many
        people clicked on what response. You can also see who you sent teh poll to and when teh poll ended, or will end if
        ongoing.

Collecting responses is as simple as clicking on a poll in your dashboard. You get a clear % breakdown of how many
        people clicked on what response. You can also see who you sent teh poll to and when teh poll ended, or will end if
        ongoing.

llecting responses is as simple as clicking on a poll in your dashboard. You get a clear % breakdown of how many
        people clicked on what response. You can also see who you sent teh poll to and when teh poll ended, or will end if
        ongoing.
ee490370-5ce5-46ab-8743-3841752bd890:
If this is the first poll you have created then teh next step will take you to a page where you can select people you
        want to send the poll to. You will be given unique url for teh poll that you can manually give to people manually,
        or you can enter email addresses for teh people you want to send to or you can import your contact from facebook
        and add then select them. You must select a minimum of 10 people for a poll so that the responses stay anonymous.

The first group of people that you send a poll to gets saved as your circle of trust. Rather than having to select
        all the same people again you can just send another poll to teh same circle.
You can create new circles, add or remove people form a circle or just send polls to people
671254d4-5b62-452c-8b72-cd66af96339f:
The questions can be text or image based, with singel or multiple responses. Each poll must have a minimum of two responses
        and a maximum of 4 responses. This limitation focuses the kind of polls people will use the platform for.
d1c2f734-1a3c-4912-88d7-f238471a15e7:
One of the most distinctive features of Tufte’s style is his extensive use of sidenotes. Sidenotes are like footnotes,
      except they don’t force the reader to jump their eye to the bottom of the page, but instead display off to the side
      in the margin. Perhaps you have noticed their use in this document already. You are very astute.
